channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024040682
item.description:
Report X-2024040682

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the day sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage with damage to the outer packaging. Outer packaging was torn and ripped due to being wet previously. Upon inspection the package contained 4 bottles to which 1 almost completely leaked out, and another is missing leaving two undamaged bottles left. Bottles and box were placed into a salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The package failure was due to 1 bottle having a loose cap causing almost the entirety of the product to leak out and 1 bottle to go missing due to the box getting wet. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately inspected and caps were tightened and placed upright into a salvage drum to await disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024040692
item.description:
Report X-2024040692

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD PROCESS THE MANAGER NOTICED THAT THERE WAS PRODUCT LEAKING OUT FROM THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX AND ALSO NOTICED THAT THE BOTTOM CLOSURE OF THE BOX WAS OPEN AS WELL. THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACLAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK THE PRODUCT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. INSIDE THE BOX THERE WAS A WHITE DRUM THAT HAD THE BOTTOM TORN OFF/DAMAGED WHICH THEN CAUSED APPROXIMATELY 1 POUND OF GRANULAR TO LEAK OUT OF THE BOX/DRUM. I REPACKED THE DAMAGED ITEM INTO THE SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER AND AM NOW AWAITING THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: THE BOTTOM OF THE DRUM HAD BEEN TORN/DAMAGED AND LOOKED LIKE IT WAS COMING OFF. BECAUSE OF THAT DAMAGED BOTTOM IT CAUSED APPROXIMATELY 1 POUND OF GRANULAR PRODUCT TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE BOX TO THE HAZMAT TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I CAME OVER TO RAPACK THE PRODUCT IN A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER.

item.title: Report X-2024040396
item.description:
Report X-2024040396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND THE BOTTOM CLOSURE WAS OPEN. THEY IMMEDIATELY TOOK PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK PRODUCTS IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. IT WAS REPACKED INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM. APPROXIMATELY 3 GALLONS LEAKED OUT DUE TO A PUNCTURE IN THE SIDE WALL OF ONE BOTTLE AND ALSO A LOOSE CAP ON THE OTHER BOTTLE. WAITING FOR THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: THERE IS A PUNCTURE ON THE SIDE WALL OF ONE OF THE BOTTLES WHICH CAUSED THE WHOLE TWO GALLONS TO LEAK FROM THAT BOTTLE AND ON THE OTHER BOTTLE THERE WAS A LOOSE CAP WHICH CAUSED ONLY 1 GALLON TO LEAK FROM THAT BOTTLE. A TOTAL OF 3 GALLONS LEAKED OUT ALL TOGETHER. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT AND THEN HAVING ME GO OVER RIGHT AWAY TO REPACK PRODUCTS INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM SAFELY AND PROPERLY.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during the sunrise sort in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspections showed package to be wet with internal leakage, torn open, and 1 of 4 items with a loose cap. Damage most likely caused from being placed on the wrong conveyor belt. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining content will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2024040346
item.description:
Report X-2024040346

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVN SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. FOUR BOTTLES OF RAPICIDE WERE FOUND, PART B CONTENTS WAS 100% LEAKED OUT WHILE PART A WAS 20% LEAKED OUT. THE RAMINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF RAPICIDE PART A AND B CAUSED FROM PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED IN A SALVAG DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2024040258
item.description:
Report E-2024040258

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNJ experienced a UN1210 PS-PX93 Proshine Process Ext. release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of product released to a 36’ x 24’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents were collected into (4) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024040298
item.description:
Report E-2024040298

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: MERCERVILLE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2.5 gallons of EnduraSTRIP released from a 5-gallon plastic pail due to a forklift puncture. It was reported that the release was caught onto a drip pad and pallet and nothing impacted the trailer floor or dock. Terminal personnel had already cleaned and containerized the release prior to notifying ERTS. The damaged plastic pail and spent absorbent pads were containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

DescribePack: CAP TO ALCOHOL N.O.S. 1 GALLON JUG WAS LOOSE AND LIQUID LEAKED THROUGHOUT PACKAGE. item.title: Report X-2024040242
item.description:
Report X-2024040242

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-25
  • City: KEASBEY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE OF FOUR BOTTLES OF CIDECON II WAS FOUND WITH THE CAP LOOSE AND MISSING, IT WAS FULLY LEAKED OUT. THE REAMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF CIDECON II COULD CAUSED FROM PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat in a plastic salvage drum during sunrise sort. DescribePack: Inspection showed package to be wet, torn, punctured and leaking. Most of the package is already destroyed from soaking in its own liquid, and is only identifiable by the relabel barcode placed on top of drum. Damage most likely caused from being dropped or mishandled. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining content will be disposed in a salvage drum.
